TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SecurityProtocolType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the security protocols that are supported by the Schannel security package.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration defines permissible values for the <xref:System.Net.ServicePointManager.SecurityProtocol%2A> property and specifies the security protocols that are used by instances of the <xref:System.Net.Security.SslStream> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates creating a <xref:System.Net.Sockets.TcpClient> that uses the <xref:System.Net.Security.SslStream> class to communicate with a server.
[!code-cpp[NclSslClientSync#0](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.net.securitypro_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[NclSslClientSync#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.net.securitypro_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.SecurityProtocolType Ssl3 = int32(48)

Docs.summary: Specifies the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) 3.0 security protocol.

remarks.format: ## Remarks SSL 3.0 has been superseded by the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol and is provided for backward compatibility only.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.SecurityProtocolType Tls = int32(192)

Docs.summary: Specifies the Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.0 security protocol.

remarks.format: ## Remarks TLS assumes that a connection-oriented protocol, typically TCP, is in use. The TLS protocol is defined in IETF RFC 2246.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.SecurityProtocolType Tls11 = int32(768)

Docs.summary: Specifies the Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.1 security protocol.

remarks.format:
## Remarks TLS assumes that a connection-oriented protocol, typically TCP, is in use. The TLS 1.1 protocol is defined in IETF RFC 4346.
This value is supported on [!INCLUDE[win7](~/add/includes/win7-md.md)] and later.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Net.SecurityProtocolType Tls12 = int32(3072)

Docs.summary: Specifies the Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.2 security protocol.

remarks.format:
## Remarks TLS assumes that a connection-oriented protocol, typically TCP, is in use. The TLS 1.2 protocol is defined in IETF RFC 5246.
This value is supported on [!INCLUDE[win7](~/add/includes/win7-md.md)] and later.
